treatment.description: Stems (0.6–)0.7–1.6(–2.4) dm. Basal leaves: petiole differ-entiated from blade, (1.7–)2–3.6(–4) times longer than blade; blade ovate to oblong, 4–8(–9) mm wide, base cuneate. Cauline leaves 2–6. Racemes lax to compact. Fruiting pedicels horizontal or slightly descending, forming an angle 80º or more with rachis. Flowers: petals white, 3.8–6 × 1.2–2.2(–2.9) mm. Fruits often strongly winged, obovate to obdeltate, (4–)4.8–7(–8) × (3–)3.5–5.5(–6) mm, 1–2 times as long as wide, apex truncate to strongly emarginate; style (0.8–)1–2 mm. Seeds 2–4 per fruit. 2n = 14.
treatment.discussion: Subspecies siskiyouensis is known from Curry, Douglas, and Josephine counties.
